pageContext.claim: “We lost 25 percent of our automobile industry to Mexico [under NAFTA]. We lost 30 percent to a combination of both Canada and Mexico.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often makes claims about NAFTA's effect on the U.S. economy without providing source data. American auto production has increased by 1 million vehicles a year since NAFTA took effect, according to the leading industry group. The United States undoubtedly lost millions of jobs and thousands of factories after NAFTA took effect, but the trade deal was just one of several major economic and technological developments contributing to these losses. Experts say NAFTA, by itself, had a modest effect.
